answers.answer: I would go see a doctor thats for sure, I had a stroke at age 48

Definitely  go a see a doctor, you need to know what it was so you can prevent a second one, either thru anti-clotting therapy like aspirin or blood pressure medication. You  don't want to go thru what people on this site have.

HI,How are you? Risk factors of stroke include:  high blood pressure, atrial fibrillation,  high blood cholesterol levels, diabetes, cigarette smoking, heavy alcohol consumption, drug use, obesity and unhealthy diet. You can have this evaluated further by your doctor for proper diagnosis. Complete medical history and physical examination are important in assessing if other tests should be done. This link may be helpful:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stroke#ClassificationTake care and keep us posted.

question: I've never dealt well with the cold, but Monday I decided to walk to my boyfriend's house after class anyway. He lives about 25 minutes away from the school. Anyway, we get into the house and I can't feel my face. It's normal with the cold weather, so I ignored it. I got into his room, put my bag down, too off my coat, and loosened my corset (steel boned). From there on I had to sit on the bed. All of a sudden I got really dizzy and my head felt like it was going to pop, my balance was all off as I couldn't even sit up on the bed, and my eyes wouldn't focus properly. Hell, I was luck if they'd even stay open for more than 3 seconds. Ontop of that, the back of my thighs kept going from frozen, almost ice cold (it felt like to me), to normal warm and back again.My boyfriend asked if I was okay, but the words wouldn't come out. I think I got one syllable out and then nothing. I had to shake my head slowly that I wasn't. My motor skills where shot, so I somehow asked him to lean me back back in the bed with pillows propped up behind me and passed out for two hours. When I woke up I felt better though.I'm pretty sure it was a stroke, but I'm only 18 years old. What do you think? Should I go see the doctor and get some scans done? I have no idea how all this works and I see no point in rushing to the hospital 3 days after it happened.
title: I think I've had a stroke, but I didn't go to the hospital. What not?
